biography.bio: Actor Salim Kechiouche was born in Lyon, France to Algerian parents. At first a kickboxing champion in France (1998), his film carreer started when actor/director Gaël Morel discovered Salim and so he made his first appearance in the movie À Toute Vitesse. From then on he appeared in more films, and many different roles like in Gigolo next to Amanda Lear, his notorious appearance in Les Amants Criminels, but also Grande École, Le Clan, Le Fil. He also made some more movies with Gaël Morel. In 2013 Salim was at the film festival in Cannes for the movie La Vie d'Adèle, a love story about a lesbian couple which won the Palme d'Or and the critic's prize. Also in 2013 he appears in the French series Odysseus as Orion and the movie Paris à Tout Prix. Next to his filmcarreer, Salim also stars in plays and theater and has been painted by artists Youssef Nabil and Michel Gilberti. Salim resides in Paris.
biography.name: Salim Kechiouche

biography.bio: Amanda Lear was born on June 18, 1939 in Saigon, French Cochinchina as Alain Tapp. She is an actress, known for Jodorowsky's Dune (2013), Dallas Buyers Club (2013) and Peep! (1995). She was previously married to Alain Philippe Malagnac d'Argens.
biography.name: Amanda Lear

biography.bio: Stéphane Rolland is an actor and editor, known for Gigolo (2005), Boys Briefs 4 (2006) and Courts mais GAY: Tome 9 (2005).
biography.name: Stéphane Rolland

biography.bio: Gilles Gleizes is an actor and casting director, known for Gigolo (2005), Les soeurs Hamlet (1996) and Oui (1995).
biography.name: Gilles Gleizes

biography.bio: Stéfanie Kirchner is an actress, known for Gigolo (2005).
biography.name: Stéfanie Kirchner

biography.bio: Saury Foulah is an actor, known for Gigolo (2005).
biography.name: Saury Foulah

biography.bio: Samantha Avrillaud is an actress, known for Métamorphoses (2014) and Gigolo (2005).
biography.name: Samantha Avrillaud

biography.bio: Ugo Broussot began his training at the Regional Drama Conservatory of Orleans in the sight of Nicole Mérouze, Jean-Claude Cotillard and Niseema Theillaud. He obtained a Bachelor of Theatre Studies at the Faculty Théâtre de Paris III (Sorbonne Nouvelle). His acting career began in the theater, where he appeared in plays such as L'Enfant Chance, Allons Z'Enfants (J.-L. Levasseur), C'est Bien (Philippe Delerm), Y'a Quelqu'un! (Bernard Friot & V. Lesergent) or Alice in Wonderland, News Stories like that (R. Demarcy). In film, he plays under the direction of Frédéric Fonteyne (Brother and Sister), Jean-Marc Moutout (K. Memories), Laurence Ferreira Barbosa (Well now dance: sketch Escal'Amore), Maria Pinto (Un Sauvage Honnête Homme, Moi qui duperais le Bon Dieu), Cristi Puiu (The Mouse is under the table).
biography.name: Ugo Broussot

biography.bio: Having trained at Drama Conservatory of Orleans in 1991 with Mérouze Nicole and Jean-Claude Cotillard, training on the experimental technique has Paris school show with Hélene Hily, he took graduate studies in theater faculty III in Paris and leads a parallel solo career mime. in 2000 he began his theatrical debut as a solo character in a Musical show in tribute Bourvil. In the theater, including playing in the "shipwrecked" by Michel Declercq, "Osceola" Michel Denneliou, "the night of the excluded" Joel Chalude, "tower Babette" Karim Houfaid, "follow the leader" by Michel Beatrix and left for an international tour in Romania, Portugal ... with "the dream of a Summer Night" by Richard Demarcy where he plays the role of Bottom. In film and television, he played under the direction of Christian Challonge in the "Imaginary Invalid", in "Cop" by Frederic Tellier, in the series "palizzi" Jean Dujardin with Arsene Mosca, my friends, my loves Lorraine Levy. From 2013 to 2014, he played the Principal Stanislavski in "Chronic gaming Edward Ez and acts as Yegor in the latest film by René Féret Chekhov.
biography.name: Bruno Davézé

companyCreditsSimple.name: Hochschule für Fernsehen und Film München (HFF)
